page.title: 05ST.PETER'S CHURCH, BENINGTON
page.content: (Part 3) The TOWER is attributed to Petronilla (Moyne) but may date from 1235 or earl- ier. In the Tower is housed the Ring of Eight Bells considered by many to be the finest of that weight in the count- ry. The oldest is dated 1626.They prac- tise on Mondays and are rung regularly on Sundays. During the restoration of the Tower in 1907, several carved heads were revealed. One of these is known as Â£Stalin's Head',but is really a like- ness of a contemporary sexton. The history of the building stands pre- sent for all to see and draw upon for their sense of belonging to time past as well as time present.
